senses.sense_definition: To lower someone or something in dignity, respect, or social standing.

examples.text: I would never <w>demean</w> myself by responding to such rude comments.
The manager's harsh criticism served only to <w>demean</w> the staff in front of the customers.

senses.sense_definition: To subtract the mathematical mean from a set of data values.

examples.text: You must <w>demean</w> the variables before running the regression analysis.
The software will automatically <w>demean</w> the dataset to center it around zero.

senses.sense_definition: To conduct or behave oneself in a particular manner.

examples.text: He <w>demeaned</w> himself with the dignity expected of a king.
They <w>demeaned</w> themselves strictly according to the instructions they were given.

senses.sense_definition: Behavior, conduct, or manner of bearing oneself.

examples.text: The knight approached the king with a grave and solemn <w>demean</w>.
Her noble <w>demean</w> impressed everyone at the court.
